textMarkdown:
Identify A in the following reaction.

![Reaction Scheme](/questions/jan21m_q53_reaction.svg)
(Note: Reaction involves Hydrogenation and Oxidative Cleavage)

solution.textSolutionLatex:
**1. Analysis of Hydrogenation:**
The first reaction shows $A + 2H_2 \xrightarrow{Pt} \text{Decalin}$ (decahydronaphthalene).

**Insight:** Since 2 moles of $H_2$ are consumed to reach the fully saturated bicyclic system, the starting material A must contain exactly two double bonds.All four options meet this criteria, so we must look at the oxidative cleavage for the final distinction.

**2. Analysis of Oxidative Cleavage ($KMnO_4$):** The second reaction shows A reacting with $KMnO_4$ (likely hot/alkaline) to produce:Cyclohexane-1,2-dicarboxylic acid, Oxalic acid ($HOOC-COOH$). 

Here are some examples for you to revise and practice.
.
.
.

textMarkdown: A hydrocarbon 'P' ($C_4H_8$) on reaction with HCl gives an optically active compound 'Q' ($C_4H_9Cl$) which on reaction with one mole of ammonia gives compound 'R' ($C_4H_{11}N$). 'R' on diazotization followed by hydrolysis gives 'S'. Identify P, Q, R and S.
